guide.introduction: Sometimes, the simplest recipes are the best. These succulent pork ribs are great at barbecues and can be served cold at picnics, yet they only take a few minutes to prepare. Although this recipe calls for pork ribs, the marinade works equally well on belly draft, pork chops, chicken wings, or even Quorn fillets.
guide.introduction_rendered:
Sometimes, the simplest recipes are the best. These succulent pork ribs are great at barbecues and can be served cold at picnics, yet they only take a few minutes to prepare. Although this recipe calls for pork ribs, the marinade works equally well on belly draft, pork chops, chicken wings, or even Quorn fillets.

Relevant parts
  • Honey
  • Five spice seasoning
  • Parsley
  • Soy sauce
  • Pork ribs
Tools
  • Oven

lines.text: Cut the pork into individual ribs.
lines.text_raw: Cut the pork into individual ribs.

lines.text: Mix the honey, parsley, five-spice seasoning, and soy in a cup or bowl.
lines.text_raw: Mix the honey, parsley, five-spice seasoning, and soy in a cup or bowl.

lines.text: Coat the ribs in the marinade and leave the pork to rest for at least 2 hours.
lines.text_raw: Coat the ribs in the marinade and leave the pork to rest for at least 2 hours.

lines.text: Place the ribs in an oven-safe pan and cook for approximately 45 minutes. Turn and baste occasionally during cooking.
lines.text_raw: Place the ribs in an oven-safe pan and cook for approximately 45 minutes. Turn and baste occasionally during cooking.

lines.text: Increase the temperature to 475° for a further 10 minutes. This will help to caramelize the tips of the ribs.
lines.text_raw: Increase the temperature to 475° for a further 10 minutes. This will help to caramelize the tips of the ribs.

lines.text: Serve your ribs on a bed of turmeric rice, with a choice of barbecue, lime, and chili dipping sauces.

guide.summary: Simple succulent pork ribs for your next 'cue.
guide.title: Honey Barbecue Ribs
